q: . It is very outspoken about energy management and scored top marks for public advocacy, and Greenpeace praised its PowerMeter tool, for measuring energy consumption in homes. But its corporate secrecy let it down. Google has steadfastly refused to release any meaningful data on its own energy use or carbon emissions, citing concerns over disclosing information that could be used by its competitors, even though its arch-rival Microsoft is transparent on this issue, Greenpeace said. It still finished slightly ahead of Microsoft, which also hasn't published emissions targets. Greenpeace faulted CEO Steve Ballmer for failing to`` effectively articulate the importance of climate protection and clean energy transformation
